column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I have been a member of the Art Institute going on six years and am dismayed that I have not yet reviewed it
column2: a situation that I seek to rectify now. This cultural institution embodies the best any venue can hope to offer--visual stimulation (artworks and people watching)
column7: and even libations if one's visit happens to coincide with a special/after hours program. I came here most recently for the Evening Associates happy hour to celebrate the opening night of Christopher Williams' first retrospective photography exhibit. The exhibit was impressive in its scope
column8: as it was a multipart exhibition spanning three galleries. I particularly enjoyed gaining early access to a specific exhibit and was enriched by the brief curator talks that accompanied the viewing. As a bonus
column9: there was a cash bar setup offered
column10: as this event took place on a Thursday during the museum's extended hours.
